column4: How do I make sure my PCMCIA wireless card is working in Ubuntu?
try it and see...
wiki.ubuntu.com/WifiHowto
Is it possible to use WPA in Ubuntu?
yes
how would I enable a .pid file to be written on?
that's not what it says
also, if you're getting an error *like* that, you need to configure kisme to use the card type you have
can you help me out with some troubleshooting?
unless it's very specific, I don't have time atm, sorry
for?
have you asked on the user list?
do you think you can take a stab at my issue
have you asked on the user list yet?
Not for the general user, though - and that is because of GUIs
I think you're jumping to a conclusion with no evidence
Also, things "jsut work"
yes, I think the just work aspect is far more important than silly gui tools
Look at my situation. I'm really laughing here
yes, you're in a small minority
everything on my laptop worked perfectly out of the box with ubuntu
I know you're frustrated, but generalising your experience to everyone's is silly
I'm not, I'm generalising based on data
no, you're not
what evidence do you have that gui tools are what makes windows popular?
again, I had to do nothing to get my wireless to work
you're unlucky in this regard
yes, you have bad hardware
yes, but your video chipset lies about what modes it supports
hence the need to hack around it
it would work under linux, too, if the manufacturer would tell the X people how to get the real resolutions out of it
prism2 is not "top of the line", either
Do you TRUELY believe that a Linux install, any distrobution, is more compatible over ALL hardware than a Windows machine?
did I say that?
please stop putting words into my mouth
It was implied, at least that's what I read
I certainly believe that ubuntu out of the box supports on the same order of magnitude hardware as windows
again, you're making things up
have you actually done a test with this?  or are you assuming again, based on the fact windows is more popular at the present time?
have you tried making use of ubuntu's professional support?
if not, please refrain from commenting on it
I'm talking about being able to call a manufacture, or Windows FREE (Once you've registered your software) support and say this doesn't work
ok!
I can't call Senao and tell them my card doesn't function in Linux. They'd laugh at me
perhaps you should buy from companies that care then
You're being bias again
but, again, remember you're in a tiny minority
I'll give you minority
what?
you're upset and letting that affect your judgement
again, please, I know more about this than you
You know more about Linux, not Windows. You don't need to be condecending.
no, I know more about which hardware works
I agree
the vast majority of people do not have problems.  you are in a small minority.
what email address did you use to write to the list?
Keep in mind 2 people that are stuck in my sitation are crimsun and tritium. It's not like the people that have made an atempt to help me haven't done so "usefully"
your post to the list wasn't very useful
Forgive me
things like "I install it. It didn't work." doesn't give anyone any information to help you with
perhaps you meant "I loaded the module manually, and it succeeded, but according to dmesg no card was found.", or perhaps not.
I'd really apprciate if you used your knowledge to try to see at least what my isssue is.
so, your card is detected then
I rfmod'd the hostap drivers, and started anew from the wlan-ng drivers
well, the card is detected
Yes. But it isn't working. ;)
the card thinks it's out of range of the ap
How do you know this
that's what that message means.  it's trying to associate, but failing because the signal is too week.

I'm literally directly on top of my router (acting AP), and I've connected to my network using this exact setup (Senao NL 2551 Plus Ext + 10 dBi omni direction antenna) houndreds of feet away in Windows
ok!
So why does the card think it's out of range?
no idea
So what do you recommend I do now?
try a different card
because something about the card is probably fucked, it just isn't manifested under windows
try another and prove me wrong
or maybe the linux drivers (all 3 of them) are screwed
I've been here a week, that's a given.
as I've said numerous times, IRC is a terrible medium for everything
gentoo uses whatever you want, just like ubuntu
let me guess, kismet?
Yes
you need to configure it
ie tell it what sort of card you have
where are the config files? I'm in the readme right now, but it'd be nice just to go right to them :P
/etc/kismet/kismet.conf
thanks :)
all config files for non-user thingfgs are in /etc
How do I tell the name of the source?
presumably prism2source
when you start what?
you haven't shown us the error yet
it means what it says, the machine called host.dreamhost.com
if the problem was that openssh wasn't installed, that would be immediately obvious
Okay, thanks
is username your actual username on that machine?
